New Official Site; MFO Online On 19th!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Farm Online Games (Computer): Monster Farm: Online (the original ranching game, no longer available): Miscellaneous Q&A : New Official Site; MFO Online On 19th!
By GM on Saturday, December 8, 2007 - 03:04 pm:

What has two thumbs and just came back?

Me.

Guess what? The official site has been completely transformed. In fact, there's a placeholder for the client download! Actually, they've got two special download placeholders, one for MFO, and one for a "fansite kit". They've also got instructions for installation and how to play. There's even a webcomic!

Can you take a look, Lisa? And if possible, can you make head or tail of the "story", or any of the other things on there?

Hooray!

By Slickriptide on Wednesday, December 12, 2007 - 10:18 am:

Are they still following the micro-payment model? Is the game playable at all by American players with American versions of Windows?

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, December 12, 2007 - 12:06 pm:

Don't know about the latest version of the software, in the last beta you could play with American windows, but you need to change the default language.

It's supposed to have the micro-payment feature, but they didn't test that, so I don't know anything about it. I do know that not all US credit cards automatically convert currency, so setting up payment may be troublesome for some players. My Paypal debit card works fine for such things, though.

By GM on Wednesday, December 12, 2007 - 04:05 pm:

What of the fansite kit? Why would we need a kit to make a fansite?

I'm keen on signing up, but I know not how to make an account. How would I go abouts that?

I should start adding more monsters to the list.

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, December 12, 2007 - 06:14 pm:

The intro page is like a basic guide you'd see in a console game's booklet. It's some basic text about make a monster, take it to the ranch, feed it, etc. No big details.

To make an account, Click HERE. Click the orange box on the left that says "click".

You need your browser set to JP language and a an application that allows you to type in JP characters. Most of the signup is text which can be typed in English, however, towards the end, there's one of those confirmation boxes where you have to read characters written all squiggly with a funny background to confirm that you aren't a spambot. The confirmation characters when I did it were in all three character sets.
